senses.sense_definition: A short play, musical, or performance presented after the main theatrical production.

examples.text: The audience laughed heartily at the comic <w>afterpiece</w> that followed the heavy tragedy.
In the 18th century, a short <w>afterpiece</w> was often performed to conclude the evening's entertainment.

traits.comment: refers to a historical theatrical practice

senses.sense_definition: The lowest part or heel of a rudder on a ship.

examples.text: The diver inspected the <w>afterpiece</w> of the rudder for any signs of damage.
They needed to replace the timber on the <w>afterpiece</w> before the ship could sail again.
